column4: hi. i just reinstalled my nvidia geforce4 legacy driver on feisty fawn, and now, after being down for a few days, x gives me the x windows log in, but fails to actually load my desktop.  what can i do to fix this?
you are sure this has something to do with the nvidia driver? looks more like a problem loading your gnome session
yea, i think it's gnome, otherwise i wouldn't get any giu
try to log in on a text console (ctrl-alt-f1) and check the file .xsession-errors
yea. there's an error, i'll pastebin it
http://pastebin.ca/724084
is that the complete file?
no, i left out the begining
looks like the shell doesn't like the syntax in one of the session scripts
is this a clean install of feisty?
maybe
i don't use gnome here, so i can't tell exactly
i don't use kde either
i am running xfce here
could i use that?
but i do have that /etc/gdm/Xsession here
md5sum of my /etc/gdm/Xsession is: 60f055534fa6b3a1497c92fabbfd8f63
i don't think that's it, there's no opening parenthese before line 12 anyway
right, line 12 is a comment
another reason for not starting X session could be no space left on the filesystem
check with  df -h
hmm
i'm installing kde
before installing such a beast, try with fluxbox or something
